title: How to Check Your Windows Version

steps.title: Press the ⊞ Win+R keys together.
steps.content: Press the ⊞ Win + R keys together. This opens the Run dialogue box on Windows. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Alternatively, you can right-click the Start menu button and click Run .

steps.title: Type winver and hit ↵ Enter or click OK.
steps.content: Type winver and hit ↵ Enter or click OK . This opens "About Windows" in a separate window. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Check your version.
steps.content: Check your version. Your Windows release will be displayed at the top of the About Windows window. Your Windows version is displayed next to "Version" and your build number is displayed next to "Build" to the right of "Version. (e.g. "Version 6.3 (Build 9600)"). As of January 2022, the latest version of Windows 10 is Version 21H2. If you are not running the latest version of Windows, it's recommended that you update Windows immediately.

steps.title: Click the Windows Start menu .
steps.content: Click the Windows Start menu . It's the button with the Windows logo. By default, it's in the lower-left corner in the Windows taskbar. This displays the start menu. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click the gear icon .
steps.content: Click the gear icon . It's in the sidebar to the left of the Windows Start menu. This displays the Settings menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click System.
steps.content: Click System . It's next to an icon that resembles a laptop computer. It's the first option in the Windows Settings menu. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click About.
steps.content: Click About . It's the last option in the sidebar to the left. This displays information about your system. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Scroll down and check your device and Windows specifications.
steps.content: Scroll down and check your device and Windows specifications. This information is displayed on the "About" page in Windows Settings. As of May 2020, the latest version of Windows 10 is Version 2004. Your system type (i.e. 32-bit/64-bit) is displayed next to System Type below "Device Specifications". Your Windows Edition (i.e. Windows 10 Home) is displayed next to Edition below "Windows Specifications". Your Windows version is displayed next to Version below "Windows Specifications". Your Windows Build number is displayed next to OS Build , below "Windows Specifications".

steps.title: Click the Windows Start menu .
steps.content: Click the Windows Start menu . It's the button with the Windows logo. By default, it's in the lower-left corner in the Windows taskbar. This displays the start menu. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Alternatively, you can press the Win + Pause keys to display the System Information screen in the Control Panel.

steps.title: Type Control Panel.
steps.content: Type Control Panel . This displays the Control Panel in the Start menu.

steps.title: Click the Control Panel icon.
steps.content: Click the Control Panel icon. It has an icon that resembles a blue screen with graphs. This opens the Control Panel.

steps.title: Click System.
steps.content: Click System . You will find your system information displayed in this Window. [8] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Your Windows Edition (i.e. Windows 10 Home) is displayed below "Windows edition". Your system type (i.e. 32-bit/64-bit) is displayed next to System Type below "System".

steps.title: Open System Information.
steps.content: Open System Information . Click on the Search bar and type “ System Information ” in its search box. Select it from the result. [9] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select a tab to view.
steps.content: Select a tab to view. There are three tabs listed in the top-left corner under System Summary which are Hardware Resources , Components and Software Environment . Click on “ + ” in front of each tab to select and view a subcategory.
